alert.note: Alert for Lower Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 2:58AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. John The Baptist, west central St. Tammany and southeastern Tangipahoa Parishes through 330 AM CDT... At 257 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Lake Pontchartrain 10 miles southwest of Madisonville, or 16 miles southwest of Covington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madisonville and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 54 and 57. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist
